duties_responsibilities.duty: Monitor and analyze interactions between contact center agents and customers to ensure performance standards are met.
Provide feedback to supervisors, managers, and agents regarding agent performance.
Identify training and coaching trends and work with training staff to address them.
Participate in design of customer interaction monitoring formats and quality standards.
Compile and track performance data at team and individual levels.
Conduct customer listening programs to identify needs and expectations.
Prepare and analyze quality reports for management review.
Coordinate call calibration sessions for contact center staff.
Communicate effectively with management in a level of indirect authority.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree from a four-year College or university preferred. A combination of a minimum of two years of insurance experience, contact center experience, and/or quality assurance experience is preferred. Property/Casualty Insurance Agents License from the state of Wisconsin OR ability to obtain within 30 days of employment.
